history.content:
The Autonomous Empirical Research Group (http://www.empiricalresearch.ai) is seeking a full-time Research Assistant in Machine Learning and Computational Cognitive Neuroscience at the Carney Institute for Brain Science (Brown University). For more information, see https://tinyurl.com/AERPosition

You will become part of a research team that seeks to revolutionize empirical research in cognitive neuroscience and psychology by integrating artificial intelligence into the scientific process. Our research agenda aims to help the scientific community overcome the challenge of incorporating large amounts of data into scientific theories by combining existing machine learning techniques in a closed-loop system for the generation, estimation, and empirical validation of scientific models of human information processing. This project, which is part of BRAINSTORM—an institutional program designed to bridge academia and industry—has the potential to significantly accelerate scientific discovery.

Sebastian Musslick, Ph.D.

Assistant Professor (Research), Department of Cognitive, Linguistic, and Psychological Sciences, Brown University
Schmidt Science Fellow & Brainstorm Innovator, Carney Institute for Brain Science, Brown University

190 Thayer St., Box 1821, Office 249
Providence, RI 02912
history.subject: Research Assistant Position in Machine Learning and Computational Cognitive Neuroscience
